p: Licorice from the family Leguminosae is a valuable medicinal plant in TPM, as well as several other doctrines of traditional medicines. The sweet taste of the roots is mostly due to the triterpenoid glycyrrhizin and the plant has several valuable secondary metabolites such as saponins and flavonoids ( Pastorino etÂ al., 2018). In TPM, licorice is highly respected as an antitussive medicine for different types of coughs and lung diseases and is also recommended for chronic fevers due to infections ( Aghili Khorasani, 1771).
